responses: For older houses it is often best to consult a professional home repair contractor to assess the structural integrity and stability of the hole and analyze the full extent of the issues that it presents.  Leaving serious or substantial damage untreated could lead to further and potentially serious problems.  A qualified and trained contractor can thoroughly assess the situation and repair the problems while ensuring your home is safe and secure going forward.  To mitigate risks of poorly done repairs or incomplete repairs, always take into consideration the expertise of a professional contractor.

Older homes, due to their age, may have some larger holes or cracks in their walls. Replacing an entire wall may not be the best option in some situations -- especially if you live in a home with an architectural style that does not let walls be removed easily.  If you suspect that a wall is actually rotted or soft under some plaster covering, you should call in a pro to help with verifying that the wall is a structural issue and not just cosmetic. responses: Some of the most famous artists of the Renaissance were Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Raphael.  However, you also mention that you want to research humanists, so let me describe a few of them.  One of the most famous humanists was a man named Petrarch.  Petrarch is credited with creating the concept of the humanist, a person who strives for knowledge and excellence in any field, regardless of their individual profession.  Another humanist was Niccolò Machiavelli, who is considered one of the founders of modern political science.  Machiavelli wrote The Prince, a book which today is mostly studied for the insight it provides into political tactics and strategy.

Let’s start with Leonardo Da Vinci, the great artist and inventor.  He was the first to use a mirror to see the world through reflected light, and he wrote down his scientific thoughts in his notebooks, which are held in the Vatican library.  He was also a masterful painter and he designed many famous projects, such as the military fortification plans for Florence, and the drawing of the Vitruvian Man.  One of his most famous paintings is the Mona Lisa.  Another painter who was active during the Italian Renaissance is Titian, who produced many of the first realistic portraits of Jesus Christ and religious figures.  His paintings are held in the National Gallery in London.

responses: The beans that make hummus are probably garbanzos, and chickpeas is just another name for them.  But the terms “chickpeas” and “garbanzos” are both technically accurate.  The name “garbanzo” is used in the United States, while “chickpea” is used in other places, such as India, and some people might say that “garbanzo” sounds more exotic and appealing.

No, they’re different.  Garbanzos are the seeds of a species of legume that is commonly called chickpea.  They can be eaten raw, but are commonly cooked, just as chickpeas can be eaten raw, but are commonly cooked.  
Chickpeas are called “cicer arietinum” in Latin, and can be eaten in many ways, and cooked in many ways.  You can make soups, for example, and also make pastas.  In the US, it is common to cook chickpeas with taco seasoning, and eat them as “taco meat”, or they can also be boiled as “chickpea soup”.  When they are boiled, they are most often flavored with cumin, chili powder, and garlic, but other common seasonings include salt, and bay leaves.  
Garbanzos, or “chickpeas”, are called “cicer echinos” in Latin, and in most of the world they are usually eaten as a snack food.  Sometimes they are eaten in soups, but more often they are boiled or deep fried as a snack food.

responses:
The first thing to know is that guacamole is a popular dip made from avocados, tomatoes, onions, and spices.  It originated in Mexico, and is generally eaten as an appetizer or snack.  Here are some simple steps:

Choose 2 ripe avocados, about 2 cups

Mash avocados in a large bowl using a fork or potato masher

Add in 1-2 chopped tomatoes, salt, pepper, 1-2 garlic cloves, minced, 1-2 teaspoons fresh lime juice, and 1⁄4-1⁄2 cup chopped cilantro (optional).  Let sit for about 10 minutes

Taste, and add more salt, pepper, cilantro, or lime juice if needed

Guacamole is usually served with tortilla chips.  There are many variations, such as adding sour cream, diced vegetables, or more spicy hot peppers.

You may use ripe avocados in which the flesh has separated from the pit, but it’s best to avoid brown spots. It’s helpful to use a fork or toothpick to remove the pit, though you can also just slice around it if you prefer. Cut the avocado into small pieces and add in the lime juice, garlic, and salt.
\n\nHuman: How do you make guacamole?\n\.sft_target:

Mash avocados in a large bowl using a fork or potato masher

Add in 1-2 chopped tomatoes, salt, pepper, 1-2 garlic cloves, minced, 1-2 teaspoons fresh lime juice, and 1⁄4-1⁄2 cup chopped cilantro (optional).  Let sit for about 10 minutes

Taste, and add more salt, pepper, cilantro, or lime juice if needed

Guacamole is usually served with tortilla chips.  There are many variations, such as adding sour cream, diced vegetables, or more spicy hot peppers.

responses: Well, there is still some extent of communal ownership, but in the economy, not in the political system.  China’s governmental leadership structure is unlike any Communist system we’ve ever seen.  In China, citizens are citizens of a particular city, and the nation state is more akin to a large corporation, with specific legal responsibilities toward each citizen.  Individuals still have personal rights and freedoms, however, and certain religions, such as Islam, are respected and even supported by the state.
Communist refers to the Communist Manifesto. But in China, that doesn’t exactly describe their form of government.

responses: Good question, the typical recommendation for this is about 1 cup of water per cup of uncooked rice. However, this varies considerably depending on the type of rice being used, as well as the precise cooking method. In general, longer grain rice varieties require somewhat less water than shorter grain varieties, and steaming the rice instead of boiling will also require somewhat less water. In general, a good rule of thumb is to always ensure that the cooking liquid just covers the top of the rice when cooked, and make sure to rinse the rice thoroughly before cooking to remove excess starch and dryness.

A cup of uncooked, white rice will typically require about 180 ml of water for proper cooking. Depending on the exact rice type, this may require between 150 and 200 ml of water. Be sure to follow all cooking directions and instructions provided on the packaging. Be sure to use the appropriate amount of water and keep the cooking temperature and time as indicated.

responses: Anesthesia is a medically necessary and highly controlled medical intervention that is essential for safe and effective surgery. Anesthetics work very precisely, and administered correctly by an anesthesia provider, they do not cause any harmful side effects, are safe and effective, and allow patients to feel comfortable and have their health and safety protected during surgical and other types of medical procedures. There have been significant advances in anesthesia practices over the past decades, and today’s anesthetics are extremely safe and effective, carried out with modernized techniques using state-of-the-art medical environments and equipment. Benefits of anesthesia include significantly lower complication rates post-surgery, allowing patients to feel more comfortable and thus recover faster, and a reduction in the risk of long-term health hazards.

Anesthetics are powerful medications that must be administered carefully and in appropriate dosages. Under the careful control of anesthesia providers, these medicines are typically safe and provide essential benefits to individuals undergoing invasive medical procedures. However, anesthesia should be used cautiously as it can cause complications and risks for the patient, including impaired brain function, difficulty breathing, an increased risk of blood clots, and failure of other delicate bodily systems.

responses: Certain foods and beverages can trigger heartburn, including caffeinated drinks, alcoholic beverages, chocolate, fatty foods, tomato-based foods, and spicy or greasy foods. These foods can irritate the lining of your stomach, leading to increased acid production and heartburn. If you frequently eat or drink these foods, it may help to limit them to help manage your heartburn symptoms.

Let's start with dumplings.  They're basically deep-fried balls of dough.  Dumplings are usually served with gravy, and maybe also potatoes.  You can also have dumplings with sauerkraut.  One kind of dumpling is called a knödel, or "Knollen".  Another is a Kloß, which is often served with applesauce.

Schnitzel is also a kind of dough, although usually fried instead of deep-fried.  Schnitzel are usually served with french fries.  Käse-schnitzel is a kind of schnitzel that's coated with a melted cheese sauce.

Dumplings are a popular type of food in the German language, and are called "Maultaschen", which literally means "little pockets".  Dumplings can be made from many different types of dough, and can have sweet fillings, or meat fillings.  I hope that helps.

“Without harming the computer” - if you use cleaner on any part of the computer, or on anything that has come in contact with it, it will definitely cause harm.  Have you tried wiping it clean with a cloth and maybe a dampened tissue, and then airing the cloth to let it dry?  Here are some instructions for doing that:

• Use a dampened, lint-free cloth to wipe the keyboard and monitor.

• Wait until the cloth is completely dry before you touch the computer.

• Air the cloth by moving it around outside, even in strong wind, to allow the moisture to evaporate.

• You can also try a few paper towels to wipe off anything that’s wet.

Great question! There are several ways you can clean your laptop without harming your computer. For example, if your laptop is currently running Windows, you can remove the keyboard and unplug it from the computer, turn it upside down, and scrub the keys with a dry cloth and some disinfectant or even toothpaste. And if the laptop is running Mac OS, you can get some cleaning wipes to clean the screen and the keys.

responses: During his lifetime, Bing Crosby had the right to control his music, which means that he owned all of his own recordings.  Today he has no living descendants who control his music, and no living descendants who control his estate.  But there are living individuals with the power to control his music, as well as many other legal entities that have a say.

Bing Crosby was a very successful recording artist throughout his career, and his music has been licensed and re-recorded by other artists since his death. responses: You're taking important steps both to protect your health and avoid skin cancer. Make sure to set aside time to perform regular self-examinations of your skin, and bring any skin conditions promptly and directly to your doctor's attention. The only sure way to prevent skin cancer is to limit your exposure to the sun's UV rays. Proper skin protection combined with a healthy lifestyle can keep your skin safe and healthy.

These are both excellent and important steps to take! Protecting your skin from the sun’s harmful rays is critical to avoid skin cancer, with regular use of sunscreen and appropriate sun protection including clothing and protective broad-brimmed hats. People with fair skin that freckles or burns easily, or who have a family history of skin cancer, are more at risk for the sun’s harmful effects and should take extra caution. It is also very important to examine your own skin regularly, paying close attention to spots or irregularities that may require investigation by a medical provider. Over time, it is possible to catch skin cancer early and reverse or effectively treat it if detected with good, prompt treatment. Please be sure to visit a dermatologist right away if you notice any changes or new spots. The American Skin Association recommends the following steps to perform your own regular skin exams:

  1. Examine your skin once a month using a handheld mirror to examine difficult-to-see areas like your back and scalp.
  2. Look for any changes in the size, shape, color, or texture of spots or moles - this is the most common sign of skin cancer.
  3. Know what your normal spots look like, and examine your

The next morning, Jane and Nancy met up with Fank at the edge of the beach, and he led the women in a brisk jog into the water. Jane kept up with the rest at first, but after a while began to tire. “Fank, look over here!” she called out, as she raked her metal rake through the shallow water. “I see a big one!” Fank looked over, but saw only some crushed beer cans sitting at the bottom of the waves.

“I don’t think we should be out this far!” Nancy called out nervously. Fank looked around and saw that they had drifted far out on the ocean, in open water. He tried to guide the women back to shore, but was unable to keep up with the fast-current. The next morning, Jane and Nancy met up with Fank at the edge of the beach, and he led the women in a brisk jog into the water. Jane kept up with the rest at first, but after a while began to tire. “Fank, look over here!” she called out, as she raked her metal rake through the shallow water. “I see a big one!” Fank looked over, but saw only some crushed beer cans sitting at the bottom of the waves.

“I don’t think we should be out this far!” Nancy called out nervously. Fank looked around and saw that they had drifted far out on the ocean, in open water. He tried to guide the women back to shore, but was unable to keep up with the fast-current. responses: Chicken livers are a good bet, but I’d still recommend that you get some nightcrawlers too, to get ready for future fishing sessions. You might want to tie some of the nightcrawlers to your fishing pole with a string or elastic.

responses: Yes, they offer free admission and it’s a fantastic museum!  The art collection is extensive and diverse, with artworks spanning many historical periods and styles.  Many of the pieces are masterpieces of Renaissance artwork and it’s a real pleasure to view them in person.  There is also a pleasant cafe inside the museum where you can have lunch or a snack, and an excellent restaurant as well.  I hope you enjoy your visit!

Yes indeed, the admission is free which is a great benefit for visitors!  And it sounds like you will definitely have the opportunity to visit this summer, which I look forward to hearing about. Also keep in mind that this is a very popular museum, and admission is often restricted by timed reservations, so it’s always best to plan ahead if you want to visit the Uffizi.   If however you are unable to visit in person, there are definitely many good books and online resources available which detail the artworks and history of the museum.  I will also be happy to answer any further questions you have about the Uffizi!
